file_content.text: You serve the Republic well.
Excellent work. We should speak to the duke.
The Spears of Organa must be retaken. Do not let them fall permanently to the Thuls!
If you will excuse us, my lord....
You will brief them here, General.
You will brief her here, General.
You will brief him here, General.
I am Duke Charle Organa, lord of House Organa and heir to the chalcedony star. I bid you welcome.
My lord Duke. It's a pleasure to meet you.
I'm honored.
The pleasure is mine. Organa's people sleep better because of you.
You sound like you've been expecting me. Do I need to be filled in?
What's this about a briefing?
Just consider yourself my guest for the moment. General?
This building would be under six meters of ash if it weren't for me.
I just saved your butt.
This planet would be beyond the reach of the Republic if it weren't for me.
You deserve an explanation. Alderaan was once a Republic member world, but when the queen died some years ago, chaos followed.
Alderaan seceded from the Republic, and the noble houses began a war for the crown. House Organa has been our ally and a voice for peace ever since.
Not many people hope for peace anymore.
That's a fine goal.
Then the obligation falls to us.
Should the Republic really be taking sides in a civil war?
So we're playing politics?
This is a moral alliance, not a political one. I want an end to violence, not a throne.
I don't need a lecture on geopolitics. Get on with it.
History bores me.
While the Republic is backing House Organa, the Empire is backing House Thul. Thul now poses the gravest threat.
If Thul defeats us, the other houses will fall--and Thul will help the Empire spread darkness across the galaxy.
I know you came to Alderaan for other reasons--but I need individuals of skill and valor to beat back this evil. Help us.
I know a good cause when I see one. I'll help.
It's the right thing to do.
The Force led me to you for a reason. I'll help.
My destiny seems to be here.
Havoc Squad has an objective already. Your orders, General?
It's the general's call.
I cannot countermand your existing orders, but I believe General Garza would approve.
I'm willing to lend a hand, but it won't come cheap.
I can't do this for free.
Organa has lost much over the years... but our coffers aren't empty yet. I think you'll be satisfied.
We'll see.
There's no time left for consideration. But I have faith you'll join us.
Of course.
You'll do House Organa proud. I'm sure of it.
The Thul army's led by Baron Jharkus Thul--one of the house heirs, and their best duelist. They call him the "Wolf Baron."
Since his last attack, Thul forces have backed away from the estate. They're trying to surround us at points Cresh, Osk and Trill.
He's after the Spears of Organa. He plans to turn our own weapons against us!
What are these "spears"?
"Spears of Organa"?
Not if I can help it.
You don't know the half of it.
This is pathetic.
Our troops have done as well as possible under difficult circumstances.
The spears are ancient defense turrets built into the bedrock. Not up to "modern" specifications--still, more powerful than any walker.
If you are correct, Thul will use them to scatter our forces and annihilate any strike team.
Perhaps--but Thul isn't expecting our new allies. Take back those turrets however you can--before they destroy us all.
Perhaps--but Thul isn't expecting a Jedi. Take back those turrets however you can--before they destroy us all.
Perhaps--but Thul isn't expecting Havoc Squad. Take back those turrets however you can--before they destroy us all.
Perhaps--but Thul isn't expecting our new ally. Take back those turrets however you can--before they destroy us all.
Our flank would remain unprotected. However... ah. General Kashim, Republic Armed Forces.
We are fortunate your team was here. The first explosion alone rattled the estate.
Jedi. We are fortunate you were here. The first explosion alone rattled the estate.
We are fortunate Havoc Squad was here. The first explosion alone rattled the estate.
We are fortunate you were here. The first explosion alone rattled the estate.
You smell like sweat and baradium. Heh. The smell of hard work.
We should speak later, but now is the time to plan--not to act. Not yet.
I can't. [Refuse quest]
More's the pity.
This is a disappointment, but we will endure without you. My lord, perhaps we should call for more reinforcements...
Depends on my duties.
